abstract: A few hundred people crowded an empty loft space recently to celebrate the 12th anniversary of WNYU's show, "Beats in Space."
snippet: A few hundred people crowded an empty loft space recently to celebrate the 12th anniversary of WNYU's show, "Beats in Space."
lead_paragraph: It was a curious scene, walking up lower Broadway in broad daylight and hearing the heavy beats pumping from a window above. A freight elevator ride and hefty door charge later, you'd never guess it was midafternoon, as a few hundred people crowded an empty loft space and danced to music played by an all-star roster of D.J.'s. The nine-hour event was in celebration of the 12th anniversary of Tim Sweeney's weekly radio show "Beats in Space," which has been broadcast every Tuesday night on WNYU (89.1) since 1999. The lineup included Rub N Tug, Kimann Foxman (of Hercules and Love Affair fame, pictured here), Matthew Dear and Sweeney himself.

headline.main: Notes From the Underground | Kimann Foxman
